wopatlasaladka: Okay the figure looks huge when you convert into percentage. But what that figure is in real? ₹300? Go inside JNU and look what they have done to the university walls? The office? The classrooms and the statue of Swami Vivekanand? Ironically those who have expensive phones, internet and what not are protesting for this fee hike. This is completely a loser take on the hike. If the fee is being hiked, there is a reason to that. A taxpayer is paying money for every goddamn thing the Government does. Nobody will be affected. Yes there are genuine students who actually can not afford the hiked fee but it doesn’t have to come out like this! A graduation student who stays in JNU hostel can easily earn a minimum of &5000 by providing tuitions only. I have also done that. This completely shows the lack of boost and confidence the students have upon themselves. Simultaneously, these protestors are affecting the sentiments of other students who are having to miss their classes because of them. Students of other centrally funded universities are outraging upon such gesture of the JNU students, look around you, look on the internet, go through honest Quora answers and see how these protests are actually affecting the way people look at JNU. “Education doesn’t have a price, it has a value” said some of the banners held during the protests, and I so disagree to that. Everything in this word comes for a price. And youngster like me can not always be in their Comfort zones. Put 2 hours a day into something, home tuition or something else, I bet, nobody will be taking less than ₹6000 per month with that. This is the tired mentality that we do not need to work hard, if all that comes for free! I am embarrassed!
